DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study test feasibility efficacy brief group therapy treatment program focus reduce pain catastrophizing adolescent young adult ( age 16-25 ) menstrual pain .
DOC.brief_title: A Behavioral Intervention Pain Catastrophizing Primary Dysmenorrhea
DOC.criteria: Female age 1625 year Selfreported menstrual cycle average 2432 day Menstrual pain rating ≥4 Numeric Rating Scale least previous three menstrual cycle prior participation Written inform consent assent ( minor , parent must also provide write parental permission ) Able read understand English Use oral contraceptive exogenous hormone previous 3 month Presence persistent pelvic pain throughout menstrual cycle Acute illness injury may impact lab performance affect sensitivity extremities Diagnosis underlie medical cause dysmenorrhea symptoms No minimal menstrual pain ( NRS rating ≤ 3 ) 3 previous cycle prior study participation Daily use opioids; participant use analgesic include , ask take analgesic day lab session Developmental delay , autism , significant anatomic impairment may preclude understand study procedure
